9 /*=====================================================================
10  * PLEASE GO READ THE DOCUMENTATION!
11  * ------------------------------------------------
12  * $tarball_directory/doc/doxygen-doc/
13  * or
14  * http://www.open-mpi.org/projects/hwloc/doc/
15  *=====================================================================
16  *
17  * FAIR WARNING: Do NOT expect to be able to figure out all the
18  * subtleties of hwloc by simply reading function prototypes and
19  * constant descrptions here in this file.
20  *
21  * Hwloc has wonderful documentation in both PDF and HTML formats for
22  * your reading pleasure. The formal documentation explains a LOT of
23  * hwloc-specific concepts, provides definitions, and discusses the
24  * "big picture" for many of the things that you'll find here in this
25  * header file.
26  *
27  * The PDF/HTML documentation was generated via Doxygen; much of what
28  * you'll see in there is also here in this file. BUT THERE IS A LOT
29  * THAT IS IN THE PDF/HTML THAT IS ***NOT*** IN hwloc.h!
30  *
31  * There are entire paragraph-length descriptions, discussions, and
32  * pretty prictures to explain subtle corner cases, provide concrete
33  * examples, etc.
34  *
35  * Please, go read the documentation. :-)
36  *
37  * Moreover there are several examples of hwloc use under doc/examples
38  * in the source tree.
39  *
40  *=====================================================================*/

163 typedef enum {
164  /* ***************************************************************
165  WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING
166 
167  If new enum values are added here, you MUST also go update the
168  obj_type_order[] and obj_order_type[] arrays in src/topology.c.
169 
170  WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING
171  *************************************************************** */
172 
173  HWLOC_OBJ_SYSTEM,
178  HWLOC_OBJ_MACHINE,
183  HWLOC_OBJ_NUMANODE,
187  HWLOC_OBJ_PACKAGE,
191  HWLOC_OBJ_CACHE,
194  HWLOC_OBJ_CORE,
198  HWLOC_OBJ_PU,
207  HWLOC_OBJ_GROUP,
219  HWLOC_OBJ_MISC,
225  HWLOC_OBJ_BRIDGE,
232  HWLOC_OBJ_PCI_DEVICE,
237  HWLOC_OBJ_OS_DEVICE,
243  HWLOC_OBJ_TYPE_MAX
245  /* ***************************************************************
246  WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING
247 
248  If new enum values are added here, you MUST also go update the
249  obj_type_order[] and obj_order_type[] arrays in src/topology.c.
250 
251  WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING
252  *************************************************************** */
253 } hwloc_obj_type_t;

322 struct hwloc_obj_memory_s {
323  hwloc_uint64_t total_memory;
324  hwloc_uint64_t local_memory;
327  unsigned page_types_len;
333  struct hwloc_obj_memory_page_type_s {
334  hwloc_uint64_t size;
335  hwloc_uint64_t count;
336  } * page_types;
337 };
338 
343 struct hwloc_obj {
344  /* physical information */
345  hwloc_obj_type_t type;
346  unsigned os_index;
350  char *name;
352  struct hwloc_obj_memory_s memory;
354  union hwloc_obj_attr_u *attr;
357  /* global position */
358  unsigned depth;
363  unsigned logical_index;
367  signed os_level;
369  /* cousins are all objects of the same type (and depth) across the entire topology */
370  struct hwloc_obj *next_cousin;
371  struct hwloc_obj *prev_cousin;
373  /* children of the same parent are siblings, even if they may have different type and depth */
374  struct hwloc_obj *parent;
375  unsigned sibling_rank;
376  struct hwloc_obj *next_sibling;
377  struct hwloc_obj *prev_sibling;
379  /* children array below this object */
380  unsigned arity;
381  struct hwloc_obj **children;
382  struct hwloc_obj *first_child;
383  struct hwloc_obj *last_child;
385  /* misc */
386  void *userdata;
391  /* cpusets and nodesets */
392  hwloc_cpuset_t cpuset;
405  hwloc_cpuset_t complete_cpuset;
416  hwloc_cpuset_t online_cpuset;
424  hwloc_cpuset_t allowed_cpuset;
435  hwloc_nodeset_t nodeset;
452  hwloc_nodeset_t complete_nodeset;
466  hwloc_nodeset_t allowed_nodeset;
479  struct hwloc_distances_s **distances;
480  unsigned distances_count;
481 
482  struct hwloc_obj_info_s *infos;
483  unsigned infos_count;
485  int symmetric_subtree;
490 };
494 typedef struct hwloc_obj * hwloc_obj_t;
495 
497 union hwloc_obj_attr_u {
499  struct hwloc_cache_attr_s {
500  hwloc_uint64_t size;
501  unsigned depth;
502  unsigned linesize;
503  int associativity;
505  hwloc_obj_cache_type_t type;
506  } cache;
508  struct hwloc_group_attr_s {
509  unsigned depth;
510  } group;
512  struct hwloc_pcidev_attr_s {
513  unsigned short domain;
514  unsigned char bus, dev, func;
515  unsigned short class_id;
516  unsigned short vendor_id, device_id, subvendor_id, subdevice_id;
517  unsigned char revision;
518  float linkspeed; /* in GB/s */
519  } pcidev;
521  struct hwloc_bridge_attr_s {
522  union {
523  struct hwloc_pcidev_attr_s pci;
524  } upstream;
525  hwloc_obj_bridge_type_t upstream_type;
526  union {
527  struct {
528  unsigned short domain;
529  unsigned char secondary_bus, subordinate_bus;
530  } pci;
531  } downstream;
532  hwloc_obj_bridge_type_t downstream_type;
533  unsigned depth;
534  } bridge;
536  struct hwloc_osdev_attr_s {
537  hwloc_obj_osdev_type_t type;
538  } osdev;
539 };
540 
554 struct hwloc_distances_s {
555  unsigned relative_depth;
557  unsigned nbobjs;
562  float *latency;
574  float latency_max;
575  float latency_base;
579 };
